name: Feature Deprecation (internal only)
title: Feature Deprecation (internal only)
body:
Overview

This article provides information about feature deprecation at Tivian, including the reasons behind it, the deprecation process, and a list of deprecated or soon-to-be deprecated features in the EFS platform.

This article has a public counterpart: Feature Deprecation.

Information

Feature deprecation is an essential part of Tivian's continuous improvement process for the EFS platform. This article explains the concept, its impact on customers, and provides details on specific features affected by deprecation.

  • Feature Deprecation Overview
  • Key Product Lifecycle Events
  • Deprecated Products Overview
  • Why Does Tivian Deprecate Features?
  • How Much Notice Will I Receive?

Feature Deprecation Overview

At Tivian, we continuously improve our EFS platform, which sometimes requires changes, replacements, or removal of existing features or modules. This process, known as feature deprecation, allows us to allocate resources to develop new and improved features while maintaining a world-class employee intelligence platform.

We carefully consider the impact on all customers when deciding to deprecate features, aiming to minimize interruptions and provide sufficient time for communication and adaptation.

Key Product Lifecycle Events

The feature deprecation process involves three main stages:

  • End of Sale - The last date on which a feature or module is available for quoting/selling to customers.
  • End of Service - The date after which customer and technical support (including bug fixes) will no longer be provided. Customers may continue to use the feature until the End of Life date.
  • End of Life

The feature is no longer available within the platform and has been replaced by improved functionality.

Why Does Tivian Deprecate Features?

Feature deprecation is necessary for SaaS software development to keep the platform modern and relevant. The main reasons for deprecation include:

  • Improving platform efficiency and innovation
  • Streamlining customer support and implementation processes
  • Delivering significant improvements to customer experiences

While change can be challenging, Tivian aims to ensure a seamless transition by developing new features that offer substantial improvements and communicating changes effectively.

How Much Notice Will I Receive Before a Feature is Deprecated?

Tivian commits to providing advance notice for feature deprecation:

  • At least 6 months notice before the End of Life date for most features
  • At least 9 months notice for high-impact features requiring customer training

Deprecation plans are maintained on the Feature Deprecation page, and customers are notified through various channels to ensure awareness and preparedness.

FAQ

What is feature deprecation?

Feature deprecation is the process of phasing out or removing existing features or modules from the EFS platform to make way for new and improved functionality.

How will feature deprecation affect my organization?

Feature deprecation may require your organization to adapt to new features or find alternative solutions. Tivian aims to minimize disruption by providing ample notice and support during the transition period.

What should I do if a feature I use is being deprecated?

If a feature you use is being deprecated, review the provided alternatives or new features. Contact Tivian support for guidance on transitioning to new solutions or adapting your workflows.
